doc.previous: Thomson Airways carried 10.5 million passengers during 2013, a 1.4% reduction compared with 2012.[6]
after: The airline's head office is in the Wigmore House near Luton, Bedfordshire.[16] The 41,250-square-foot (3,832Â m2) facility is adjacent to Luton Airport and is 33 miles (53Â km) north of London.[17]

Thomson Airways' largest base is at London-Gatwick, closely followed by Manchester with its third largest at Birmingham. Further aircraft are based at thirteen other UK airports. By Summer 2014, Belfast-International, Bournemouth, Edinburgh, Exeter and Leeds/Bradford are all served by a single based aircraft. Bases with two aircraft are at Bristol, Cardiff, Doncaster Sheffield, Glasgow and London-Stansted whilst East Midlands, London-Luton and Newcastle all have three. Some of these bases have additional aircraft through certain parts of the week to service long-haul flights.
